events.comment: For more game templates and examples, visit gametemplates.itch.io
Try any of the custom functions here

eventsFunctions.description: Move an object back and forth vertically or horizontally
eventsFunctions.name: MoveObjectBackAndForth
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ back and forth in _PARAM2_ direction _PARAM3_ pixels at speed _PARAM4_ p/s

events.comment:
at the beginning of the scene:
-get initial position of the object on the X axis
-get the initial position of the object on the Y axis
-set max distance the object moving back and forth from it initial position
-set movement speed
-set movement direction horizontal or vertical
if movement direction is horizontal, change the X position of the object by maxDistance to kick start the movement horizontally
if movement direction is vertical, change the Y position of the object by maxDistance to kick start the movement vertically
move the object right if position was <= than initialX - maxDistance
move the object left if position was >= than initialX + maxDistance
move the object down if position was <= than initialY - maxDistance
move the object up if position was >= than initialY + maxDistance

parameters.description: Object to move
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Choose the direction of movement. Can be "horizontal" or "vertical"
parameters.name: Direction

parameters.description: Distance the object going to move from it initial position
parameters.name: Distance

parameters.description: Movement speed of the object
parameters.name: MovementSpeed

eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera _PARAM1_ on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ direction with the pointer

events.comment: when mouse button is pressed, get start position of mouse
get direction selected
when mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
if selected direction is horizontal or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on X axis
if direction is vertical or both
when mouse button is pressed, move camera on Y axis

parameters.description: Camera number to drag (default: 0)
parameters.name: CamNumber

parameters.description: Name of camera layer (default "")
parameters.name: CamLayer

parameters.description: Direction you want to drag the camera. It can be "vertical" or  "horizontal" or "both"
parameters.name: Direction

eventsFunctions.description: Load image from URL and replace the current animation of an object
eventsFunctions.name: LoadImageFromURL
eventsFunctions.sentence: Load image from URL and replace current animation of object _PARAM2_

events.comment: URL to test "http://4ian.github.io/GD-Documentation/GDCore%20Documentation/gdlogo.png"
This script load an image from a URL and replace the image of the object as the selected animation

events.inlineCode:
var object = runtimeScene.getVariables().get("object").getAsString(); //get object from scene variable
var anim = runtimeScene.getVariables().get("animation").getAsNumber(); //get animation number from scene variable
var url = runtimeScene.getVariables().get("url").getAsString(); // get the url from scene variable

runtimeScene.myCallback = function(loader, resources){ // loader and ressources come from PIXI.loader

    var mySprite= resources["Sprite_Logo_GDevelop"]; //get the image from PIXI ressources
    
    var game = runtimeScene.getGame(); //get the game currently running
    
    var object_texture_image = runtimeScene.getObjects(object); // Get all the objects called "My_picture"

    var object_texture_image_renderer = object_texture_image[anim].getRendererObject(); // get the frist (and unique) objet called "My_picture" and get this renderer (PIXI sprite)

    object_texture_image_renderer.texture = mySprite.texture; // change the texture in renderer (PIXI sprite)
  

};

PIXI.loader.reset(); // reset the loader because if you press many times M key the ressources "Sprite_Logo_GDevelop" exist and crash your application
PIXI.loader.add("Sprite_Logo_GDevelop", url);  // here change the URL for get you own images from web !
PIXI.loader.load(runtimeScene.myCallback); // Use callback for load the new image

parameters.description: The URL you want to load the image from, for example "http://mywebsite/image.png"
parameters.name: ImageURL

parameters.description: The object going to use the image
parameters.name: Object

events.comment:
Get the text parameter and convert it to voice using text to speech API
Note that, this feature may not work with Chromium and Cordova and similar projects using Chromium

parameters.description: Text you want to convert to voice
parameters.name: TextToSpeech

eventsFunctions.description: Snap object to a virtual grid in the scene (it is not the grid used in the editor)
eventsFunctions.name: SnapObjectToVirtualGrid
eventsFunctions.sentence: Snap _PARAM1_ to virtual grid using Cell Width _PARAM2_ and Cell Height _PARAM3_

events.comment:
At the beginning, set the cell width and height of the in-game grid (it is not the grid used in the scene editor)
it is going to override in case you did set a different cell size before
Round the Object position to snap to the in-game grid

parameters.description: Object you want to snap to grid
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Width of an indivisual cell in the virtual grid (optional in case you have already set the cell width)
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of an individual cell in the virtual grid (optional in case you have already set the cell height)
parameters.name: CellHeight

eventsFunctions.description: Set cell size of virtual grid (it is not the grid used in the editor)
eventsFunctions.fullName: Set cell size of virtual grid
eventsFunctions.name: SetVirtualGridCellSize
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set Cell Width to _PARAM1_ and Cell Height to _PARAM2_ pixels of virtual grid

events.comment: At the beginning, set the cell width and height of the in-game grid (it is not the grid used in the scene editor)

parameters.description: Width of an individual cell in the grid
parameters.name: CellWidth

parameters.description: Height of an individual cell in the grid
parameters.name: CellHeight

eventsFunctions.description: Pin an object to an other object
eventsFunctions.name: PinObjectToAnother

events.comment: calculate distance and angle of child object at the beginning of the scene

Calculate the child distance from parent.
As the position and rotation of the children can not be changed during runtime, we need to do this calculations only at the beginning. After, we update the child position and angle using the values from here.
Update the angle and position of all child objects relative to the parent.

parameters.description: Child object going to follow the movement and rotation of the parent
parameters.name: Child

parameters.description: Parent object that you going to move and rotate
parameters.name: Parent
